data.comment: The whistle has gone to start the match.
A throw-in for the home team on the opposite half.
In the minute 2, Kansas City awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Kansas City have a dangerous throw-in.
Throw-in for Houston at BBVA Compass Stadium.
In the minute 5, Kansas City surge into the attack at BBVA Compass Stadium but Khiry Shelton’s header is off-target.
Houston have a goal kick.
Corner awarded to Houston.
In the minute 6, Ball safe as Kansas City is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Mauro Manotas for Houston gets in a strike but fails to hit the target.
Kevin Stott awards Kansas City a goal kick.
In the minute 9, Houston awarded a free kick in their own half.
Kevin Stott awards the away team a throw-in.
Throw-in Houston.
In the minute 10, Ariel Lassiter of Houston smashes in a shot on target. The keeper saves, though.
Houston to take a throw-in in Kansas City territory.
Goal kick for Kansas City at BBVA Compass Stadium.
In the minute 15, It's a goal kick for the home team in Houston.
Ball goes out of play for a Kansas City goal kick.
Kansas City have been awarded a corner by Kevin Stott.
In the minute 22, Houston have been awarded a corner by Kevin Stott.
In Houston a free kick has been awarded the away team.
Throw-in for Kansas City in their own half.
In the minute 25, Free kick for Kansas City in the half of Houston.
Kansas City's Johnny Russell gets his shot away but it misses the target.
Ball goes out of play for a Houston goal kick.
In the minute 29, Throw-in for Kansas City in their own half.
It's a goal kick for the away team in Houston.
Throw-in for Houston at BBVA Compass Stadium.
In the minute 33, In Houston Houston drive forward through Darwin Quintero. His shot is on target but it's saved.
Ball safe as Houston is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Goal! The away team take a 0-1 lead through Alan Pulido.
In the minute 34, Gianluca Busio instrumental with a fine assist.
Kevin Stott signals a Kansas City throw-in in Houston's half.
Amadou Dia (Kansas City) gets a yellow card.
In the minute 40, Free kick Houston.
Kansas City have a goal kick.
Kevin Stott signals a free kick to Kansas City.
In the minute 45, Kansas City awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Houston drive upfield and Darwin Quintero gets in a shot. The strike is blocked by a Kansas City defender.
Throw-in high up the field for Houston in Houston.
In the minute 45, Kevin Stott signals a free kick to Kansas City in their own half.
The first-half has ended.
Kiki Struna is booked for the home team.
In the minute 46, The second-half is underway at BBVA Compass Stadium.
Kevin Stott awards the home team a throw-in.
Throw-in Houston.
In the minute 48, Kevin Stott awards Houston a goal kick.
Houston advance rapidly upfield but Kevin Stott blows for offside.
Free kick for Kansas City in their own half.
In the minute 50, Kevin Stott signals a free kick to Houston.
Goal kick for Houston at BBVA Compass Stadium.
Throw-in for Houston in the half of Kansas City.
In the minute 55, Kevin Stott signals a throw-in for Kansas City, close to Houston's area.
In Houston, Kansas City push forward quickly but are pulled up for offside.
Ball safe as Kansas City is awarded a throw-in in their half.
In the minute 58, Niko Hansen is replacing Boniek Garcia for Houston at BBVA Compass Stadium.
Can Houston capitalize from this throw-in deep inside Kansas City's half?
Kansas City awarded a throw-in in their own half.
In the minute 61, Roger Espinoza is replacing Felipe Hernandez for the away team.
Can Houston get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Kansas City's half?
Corner awarded to Houston.
In the minute 62, Zarek Valentin's header is off-target for Houston.
Ball goes out of play for a Kansas City goal kick.
Free kick for Houston in the half of Kansas City.
In the minute 65, Houston are caught offside.
Can Kansas City get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Houston's half?
Kansas City push upfield but Kevin Stott quickly pulls them for offside.
Kansas City have been awarded a corner by Kevin Stott.
In the minute 69, Tab Ramos is making the team's third substitution at BBVA Compass Stadium with Christian Ramirez replacing Mauro Manotas.
The home team have replaced Ariel Lassiter with Nico Lemoine. This is the second substitution made today by Tab Ramos.
In the minute 70, It's a goal kick for the home team in Houston.
Houston to take a throw-in in Kansas City territory.
Free kick for Kansas City in their own half.
In the minute 72, Houston's Matias Vera has been booked in Houston.
Alan Pulido puts the ball in the net and the away team extend their lead. The score-line now reads 0-2.
Free kick Houston.
In the minute 76, In Houston a free kick has been awarded the away team.
At BBVA Compass Stadium, Darwin Quintero has been yellow-carded for the home team.
Winston Reid (Kansas City) has received a first yellow card.
In the minute 78, Tab Ramos (Houston) is making a fourth substitution, with Sam Junqua replacing Adam Lundqvist.
Kevin Stott signals a Houston throw-in in Kansas City's half.
Erik Hurtado is on a sub for Alan Pulido for Kansas City.
Houston awarded a free kick in their own half.
In the minute 82, Ilie Sanchez (Kansas City) has received a yellow card from Kevin Stott.
Kevin Stott signals a free kick to Kansas City in their own half.
In the minute 84, Free kick Houston.
Corner awarded to Houston.
Goal! A headed strike from the home team reduces their deficit to 1-2. Sam Junqua got above everyone else to nod it in.
In the minute 87, Goal kick for Kansas City at BBVA Compass Stadium.
Throw-in Kansas City.
The away team replace Johnny Russell with Gerso Fernandes.
In Houston a free kick has been awarded the home team.
Kansas City needs to be cautious. Houston have an attacking throw-in.
Kevin Stott awards Houston a goal kick.
The fourth official's board shows 6 minutes, which will be added to the 2nd half.
Kansas City have a goal kick.
Throw-in for Houston at BBVA Compass Stadium.
Throw-in for Houston in their own half.
Throw-in for Houston in the half of Kansas City.
Kansas City awarded a free kick in their own half.
Kansas City’s Roger Espinoza is on his feet again at BBVA Compass Stadium.
Kevin Stott awards the home team a throw-in.
The second-half is over. The match ends 1-2.
Roger Espinoza (Kansas City) has been booked and must now be careful not to get a second yellow card.
Maynor Figueroa for Houston has been booked by Kevin Stott and receives a first yellow card.
The match has been stopped briefly for attention to the injured Roger Espinoza.
Tim Melia (Kansas City) gets a yellow card.
